definition: to watch a football game (or other ball game)/Fore! (golf)/Watch out for the ball!
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

sentences.english: Drew: I would love to go.
sentences.chinese: 你想和我去工体看球吗？

sentences.english: I just waited to see where the ball was going and then threw myself at it.
sentences.chinese: 我只是等着，看球往哪边飞，然后把自己扔向那边。

sentences.english: In Merca you risk your life if caught watching the football game.
sentences.chinese: 在梅尔卡，如果被抓到看球可是要冒生命危险的。

sentences.english: At last I found it exciting to watch games with him.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我发现同他一起看球赛真令人兴奋。

sentences.english: In the meantime we could watch ball games or the horse racing.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，我们还可以看球赛和赛马。

sentences.english: Hey, guys, The World Cup is around the corner. Do you want to watch the game from the TV?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，朋友们，世界杯就要来了，你准备看球赛吗？

sentences.english: And I do feel lucky too, getting to watch the game with you tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我也觉得能和你一起看球很幸运。

sentences.english: Will Chinese leaders go to watch World Cup matches in Germany?
sentences.chinese: 中国领导人是否会去德国世界杯看球赛？

sentences.english: I must hurry. I want to get home in time to see the football match on television.
sentences.chinese: 我得赶快，我想按时回家，去看球赛。

sentences.english: But to get them to buy - is a whole different ballgame.
sentences.chinese: 但让他们买的是一个完全不同的看球。

sentences.english: Even though she's hit the ball, she's not yet looking to see where it's going.
sentences.chinese: 即使她击球以后，她仍然没有看球打到哪里了。

sentences.english: When you go to a ball game, you'll see that the Miami team is dressed in red and white.
sentences.chinese: 你看球赛时，就会看到迈阿密队穿红色和白色。

sentences.english: I'll be at the game with my friend Lisa.
sentences.chinese: 我会和我的朋友尼萨去看球赛。

sentences.english: It's a perfect day for it-a little cloudy but nice and warm.
sentences.chinese: 今天是看球的好时光，有一点云彩，但是很舒适暖和。

sentences.english: He is a season-ticket holder in the West Lower, and goes religiously.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲买的是季票，并且去看球犹如朝拜一般虔诚。

sentences.english: But I don't watch sports or buy sports magazines.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不看球赛，也不买体育报。

definition: (ball game) enthusiast (player)/golf buddy (or tennis buddy etc)
to play ball/to play with a ball
to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
